Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ad: Adeline was originally suspicious of me, but she let me stick around. Guess I have my uses!
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ar: I just got a dozen crates of "artisanal" pinecones in... what am I supposed to do with all these pinecones? And what's so artisanal about a pinecone, anyway?
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ba: Who do you suppose Juniper's =Jasmine= supplier is?
No such thing as a perfumed bath on the road, so I come to the bathhouse whenever I can.
After all my time on the road, this bathhouse is a luxury I simply can't live without.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/be: Have you ever tried getting a wagon across the sand? I can't recommend it.
There's a reason I don't do business on the beach.
I've been combing the beach, [Ari]. It's mostly debris that washes up, but you never know.
I wonder how much treasure is still sitting on the ocean floor...
According to Eiland, there's some pretty famous shipwrecks that led to the construction of that lighthouse.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/br: Morning, [Ari]! Slow down, why don't you join me for breakfast?
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/bu: Lots of ways to make money around Mistria if you know where to look.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ch: It's always a fine evening when you stop to say hi, [Ari]. Cheers!
A toast, to another beautiful day in Mistria.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/co: Evening, [Ari]. Come in from the cold, have you?
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/da: After the rush of market day, I like to relax.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/di: The archaeologists in the Capital could learn a thing or third from Eiland and Errol.
I've been to dig sites before, and it's fair to say that Eiland's is the most organized I've ever seen.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/dn: Still, what kind of name is Snicklefritz?
I kept trying to get out of Lord Eiland's little game, but he made me a character and everything.
I was skeptical, but there may be something to this Dragons & Drama that Lord Eiland's so on about.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/du: Josephine and Elsie have quite a duet going.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ei: Eiland's one of my best customers. If it's old and inscrutable he wants it, and he always pays on time.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/el: Elsie speaks fondly of the Capital, but that place only holds bad memories for me.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/fa: Ah, my favorite customer! I say that to every customer?
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/fo: To be honest... I have no idea what I'm doing.
I suppose we all need to start somewhere, eh?
Rare flowers do well in the Capital, and Celine said the foraging out here is good, but...
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ge: Cleavage, fracture and luster! These are all things you learn to have an eye for when you trade in jewels.
With gems, don't be fooled by size alone, [Ari].
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/gr: Make sure that you put $anything that you want to sell$ into the $Shipping Bin$ next to your house. I'll pick up your shipments and leave your payment overnight.
The shops in this town depend on the stock I procure for them, so we're all looking forward to your business.
[Ari]! I'm glad I bumped into you. I'd forgotten to mention...
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ha: Sometimes it's hard to sleep at the inn... but I always sleep well in my wagon. I must be used to the road.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/he: Meeting some friends for dinner. I never know what to bring! I suppose a bottle of wine never disappoints.
I would have made it a point to meet you further up the road!
If you had told me one new farmer moving to Mistria was going to boost business this way...
I can particularly recommend the inn, nothing quite like a cold drink after a long day.
Have you been taking the time to relax and enjoy Mistria's charms?
I can assure you that they'll be lucrative for both of us.
Keep an eye on the request board, I occasionally post jobs that are more suited to an adventurer like yourself.
Hemlock takes real pride in what he serves... The Sleeping Dragon is the best inn around for a reason.
Hemlock's been a real friend since I took up residence in Mistria, but I'm still not going to go easy on him when we play cards.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ho: Holt's jokes aren't that bad... or that good...
You'd think I'd be used to this cold after all the time I've spent on the road, but nothing compares to a warm hearth and a hot drink.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/in: Can't beat breakfast at the Sleeping Dragon Inn.
Hemlock and Josephine have a perfect family, don't they? Almost makes me want to settle down.
The quality for the price can't be beat.
Can't recommend lunch at the Inn enough.
You can get meals from all over the world at the Capital, but somehow nothing beats a hot meal at the Sleeping Dragon Inn.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ju: I wonder what a witchy woman like Juniper is doing with a big fluffy dog like Dozy. There's gotta be a story there.
When I first arrived in Mistria I thought I'd be passing through, but this place has its charms.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/la: My delivery never showed. Did they run into trouble on the road? Just bad weather, I hope.
Here to see the latest? Have a look.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/le: If you're looking for something a bit... off the beaten path, just let me know. I can ask around.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/lo: But at least it's honest work, eh?
I've grown fond of Mistria, and the Sleeping Dragon Inn. It's a funny feeling.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ma: Maple's a clever kid so I taught her some sleight of hand, but Reina drew the line at knife tricks. I think she'd be a natural!
If you ever want an easy win, play March in cards. His face is an open book!
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/mi: Mistria's pretty, isn't it? I can see why it's been attracting new residents. Like us!
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/mu: My favorite exhibits at the museum are the ones that glitter the most, naturally.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ne: Nice to see you, [Ari]! I got some exciting new inventory in.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/no: Some days luck doesn't go your way, but there's always tomorrow.
Nora says I should open a brick and mortar store, but I'm not ready to put down roots just yet. You always have an exit strategy when your life is on wheels.
Not a big fan of the rain. Hard to be a traveling merchant in this weather.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/oc: Nothing like a sweet breeze off the ocean.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ov: I try not to do too many overnight trips if I can help it. The longer the trip, the more potential for something to go off kilter with the deal...
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/pr: There may be a clue to a valuable cache elsewhere, don't you think?
The ruins here are magnificent. I've seen these scattered around Aldaria, but nothing so well-preserved as these.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ra: You're sunshine even in the rain, [Ari].
Of all the things on my resume, "rainy day babysitter" might be the most unexpected.
Strange means rare, and rare fetches a handsome sum.
They say strange things are found in the Mines.
I've got some rarities for you today. Have a look.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ro: I've done enough traveling to appreciate having a roof over my head when the sky opens up.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/sa: Last month's sales were decent, but requests for special items were up.
After a long week of hauling my goods around, this feels nice... real nice.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/sc: You'd like to know the story? Another time, perhaps.
You're staring, [Ari]. Is it the scar?
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/so: I'd say I'm more of a social drinker. Don't have much use for a glass of wine or a pint on the road.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/sp: There's nothing nicer than a finely cut gemstone. Do let me know if you come across any!
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/st: No merchant worth his salt is a stranger to the elements.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/su: I never knew the joys of an idle summer Sunday until I left the Capital behind.
Sometimes it surprises me too, come to think of it.
Have a look, [Ari]! You never know what I might have in stock today.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/ta: Take your time, let me know if anything strikes your fancy.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/tr: Though Eiland assures me it's all treasure.
Trash or treasure, you never know what you might dig up...
Oh, I may look like I'm lazing the day away, but I'm thinking up new business ventures the whole time... hahaha!
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/up: Updating the ledger is the most boring part of being a merchant, but if there's one thing I've learned from Nora, it's the value of keeping precise records.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/va: It's important to stay on top of my health, and I trust Valen's advice. The road is no place to find out you're not in tip-top shape.
What I like about Valen is she treats you, no questions asked.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/wa: So be sure to have a look!
Every day brings something new! In my shop, anyway.
It's a nice time of year to be outside, don't you think?
Having a shop on wheels has its benefits.
Well, hello there! Don't suppose you know anything about wagon axles?
This season really puts the wanderlust in me. It's beautiful out here.
Work is for tomorrow's Balor. Today it's sand and waves!
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/we: Hope the town's treating you well.
I can see why Eiland spends so much time out here. These ruins are quite impressive.
Conversations/Bank/Balor/Banked Lines/wi: Nothing better than winding down at the Inn after spending a day in the winter chill.
